alert.note: Alert for Southeastern Brooks Range (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued February 07 at 6:04PM AKST until February 09 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Dangerously cold wind chills to 65 below occuring, and blowing snow with reduced visibility to one half mile or less at times. * WHERE...Near Passes of the Southeastern Brooks Range. * WHEN...Now to noon Wednesday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...North winds gusting to 45 mph are causing blowing and drifting snow with low visibility and dangerously cold wind chills. Large snow drifts will form. The dangerously cold wind chills will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Wind Chill Warning means the combination of very cold air and sustained wind speeds of 15 mph or more will create dangerously low wind chill values. Frost bite can occur quickly and even hypothermia or death if precautions are not taken.
